meanings.definition: The amount that a tank can hold.
meanings.sent1: I needed two tankfuls of gas to fill up my car completely.
meanings.sent2: The gas station attendant filled the tank with two tankfuls of fuel.
meanings.sent3: It took three tankfuls of water to fill up the swimming pool.
meanings.sent4: The farmer used multiple tankfuls of fertilizer to nourish the crops.
meanings.sent5: The aquarium needed regular tankfuls of water to keep the fish healthy.

meanings.definition: The act of filling a tank to capacity.
meanings.sent1: After many tankfuls, the reservoir was finally full.
meanings.sent2: The truck driver completed the delivery with several tankfuls of gas.
meanings.sent3: The tankfuls of laughter at the comedy show echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was overflowing with tankfuls of love for her family.
meanings.sent5: The factory required constant tankfuls of raw materials to keep production going.
